page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area contains three main villages, Old Wives Lees, Chilham and Shottenden.Old Wives Lees is a quiet little village mostly surrounded by farmland and woods. Chilham is also a small village with many old houses. Shottenden is quite small too and is off the main road.Much of these villages is farmland.There are fruit farms, farms that keep animals, crop farms growing such crops as wheat and barley. The main roads lead from Canterbury to Maidstone and Canterbury to Ashford. The river Stour runs near Chilham and it is a small, fast flowing river with fish in it.The lake at Chilham was once a large gravel pit but now it is a lake with lots of wildlife.
